thread.title: Bristol-Myers, Five Prime to Develop Cancer Treatments
thread.title_full: Bristol-Myers, Five Prime to Develop Cancer Treatments

author: morningstar.com
title: Bristol-Myers, Five Prime to Develop Cancer Treatments
text:
By Ezequiel Minaya
Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. said Thursday it has struck an exclusive licensing and collaboration deal to develop and market cancer treatments with Five Prime Therapeutics Inc.
The partnership will center on Five Prime's antibody program, which includes FPA008, a product in early development in the drug company's pipeline.
The agreement replaces the existing deal, struck in November 2014, between the companies to evaluate treatments combining Bristol-Myers' drug Opdivo and Five Prime's FPA008.
Opdivo, also known as nivolumab, was first approved for sale in December to treat patients with advanced melanoma, a skin cancer. In March, the FDA extended the use to treat advanced lung cancer.
Under the deal, Bristol-Myers Squibb will pay Five Prime $350 million. In addition to the upfront sum, Five Prime will be eligible to receive more than $1.3 billion in development and regulatory milestone payments as well as royalties.
FPA008 is a drug from the hot field of immuno-oncology, which looks for ways to use the immune system to battle cancer.
Write to Ezequiel Minaya at ezequiel.minaya@wsj.com
 15, 2015 07:24 ET (11:24
